contentrichtext.text: {{multiple issues| {{lead too short|date=June 2012}} {{primary sources|date=June 2012}} {{refimprove|date=June 2012}} }} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2010}} {{Infobox scientist |name = Zygmunt Florenty Wróblewski |image =Zygmunt Wróblewski.PNG |image_size =150px |caption = Zygmunt Florenty Wróblewski |birth_date = 28 October 1845 |birth_place = [[Grodno]] |death_date = {{Death date and age|df=y|1888|4|16|1845|10|28}} |death_place = [[Kraków]] |residence = |citizenship = |nationality = Polish |ethnicity = |field = Chemistry<br/>physics |work_institutions = |alma_mater = [[Kiev University]]<br/>[[Munich University]] |doctoral_advisor = |doctoral_students = |known_for = [[condensation]]<br/>[[liquefaction]] |author_abbrev_bot = |author_abbrev_zoo = |influences = |influenced = |prizes = |religion = |footnotes = |signature = }} '''Zygmunt Florenty Wróblewski''' (28 October 1845 – 16 April 1888) was a [[Poland|Polish]] [[physicist]] and [[chemist]]. ==Life== Wróblewski was born in [[Grodno]] ([[Russian Empire]], now in [[Belarus]]). He studied at [[Kiev University]]. After a six-year exile for participating in the [[January Uprising|January 1863 Uprising]] against [[Imperial Russia]], he studied in Berlin and [[Heidelberg]]. He defended his doctoral dissertation at [[Munich University]] in 1876 and became an assistant professor at [[Strassburg University]]. In 1880 he became a member of the [[Polish Academy of Learning]]. Wróblewski was introduced to gas [[condensation]] in Paris by Professor Caillet at the [[École Normale Supérieure]]. When Wróblewski was offered a chair in physics at [[Jagiellonian University]], he accepted. At [[Kraków]] he began studying gases and soon established a collaboration with [[Karol Olszewski]]. While studying [[carbonic acid]], Wróblewski discovered the [[Carbon dioxide clathrate|CO<sub>2</sub> hydrate]]. He reported this finding in 1882.<ref>S. Wroblewski (1882 a), "On the combination of carbonic acid and water" {{fr icon}}, ''Acad. Sci. Paris, Comptes rendus'', 94, pp. 212–213.</ref><ref>S. Wroblewski (1882 b), "On the composition of the hydrate of carbonic acid" (in French), ''Acad. Sci. Paris, ibid.'', pp. 954–958.</ref><ref>S. Wroblewski (1882 c), "On the laws of solubility of carbonic acid in water at high pressures" {{fr icon}}, ''Acad. Sci. Paris, ibid.'', pp. 1355–1357.</ref> On 29 March 1883 Wróblewski and Olszewski used a new method of condensing [[oxygen]], and on 13 April the same year—[[nitrogen]]. In 1888, while studying the physical properties of [[hydrogen]], Wróblewski upset a [[kerosene lamp]] and was severely burned. He died soon after at a [[Kraków]] hospital. [[Karol Olszewski]] continued the experiments, using an improved Pictet cascade apparatus, and [[carbon dioxide]], boiling [[ethylene]] in [[vacuum]], and boiling nitrogen and boiling air as cooling agents. [[Image:Krakow Olszewski Wroblewski plaque.jpg|thumb|center|300px|<center>'''Inscription in [[Polish language|Polish]] and [[Latin]]:'''<BR>"In this building<BR>[[Karol Olszewski]] and<BR>Zygmunt Wróblewski<BR>professors at [[Jagiellonian University]]<BR>in 1883<BR>for the first time in the world liquifed<BR>components of air<BR>thereby opening to science and industry<BR>new fields of research and application"]] ==Books== *''Ueber die Diffusion der Gase durch absorbirende Substanzen'' (On the Diffusion of Gases through Absorbing Substances, 1874) ==See also== {{Commons category|Zygmunt Wróblewski}} *[[Timeline of low-temperature technology]] *[[Timeline of hydrogen technologies]] *[[List of Poles#Physics|List of Poles]] == Notes == <references/> {{Authority control|VIAF=49458664}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Wroblewski, Zygmunt | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Polish scientist | DATE OF BIRTH =28 October 1845 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Grodno]] | DATE OF DEATH =16 April 1888 | PLACE OF DEATH =[[Kraków]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wroblewski, Zygmunt}} [[Category:1845 births]] [[Category:1888 deaths]] [[Category:University of Heidelberg alumni]] [[Category:Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich alumni]] [[Category:Jagiellonian University faculty]] [[Category:People from Grodno]] [[Category:Polish chemists]] [[Category:Polish physicists]] [[Category:January Uprising participants]] [[Category:Accidental deaths in Poland]] [[Category:Polish exiles in the Russian Empire]]
